Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture, sound and value
Reviews.Author: OlyNomad
Reviews.Content: We bought this Vizio 42" last week and are very happy with it.  Crystal clear picture and great sound.  Easy to set up and the remote is nice.  My only issue was I couldn't handle the Vizio logo on front being lit up white while watching, it was very distracting to me so I wrote to Vizio to ask about how to turn it off and they sent me the following instructions that thankfully worked.To turn the Vizio light on or off:1. Press the MENU button on the remote.  The on-screen menu is displayed.2. Use the Arrow buttons on the remote to highlight the Settings icon and press OK.  The Settings menu is displayed.3. Highlight LED Logo Settings and press OK.4. Use the Up/Down Arrow buttons to select On or Off, then press OK.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture and Apps.  Some sound issues
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: We have been very pleased with this television.  Setup was a snap - you plug in your cables, select the source, and set up the WiFi.  It took five minutes, if that.  The picture is very good whether on 1080p Blu-Ray and on lower resolution images.  The internet apps are also easy to use, we had Netflix and Pandora running in just a few minutes as well.  The Netflix app could use some work - I find the AppleTV much easier to use Netflix with.HDMI sound from cable broadcasts is the one major issue I had with it.  We have AT&T; U-Verse and it would constantly break up.  The problem didn't happen on DVD or Blu-Ray.  Nor does it happen on any other TV we have in the house using HDMI from the U-Verse boxes.  From what I can see on the Internet, this is not uncommon with some HDMI sources and can usually be fixed by changing a sync setting on the TV.  Even after doing this, we still saw the issue.  U-Verse is 1080i, though, so we just switched back to component video and audio (which supports up to 1080i) for U-Verse and the problem went away.  It's still disappointing to have the problem, however.The only other issue (minor) is that the remote doesn't control anything except the TV.  We will probably have to get a universal remote now.Overall, we are very pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: DeepPurple23
Reviews.Content: First off I must say that you are paying a fraction of the price for a similar Samsung or LG TV.  This one is American made so for me that was an added plus.  The picture is great, the setup was easy.  Personally, I don't look for my TV to be able to surf the web, however, I do want it to have automatic firmware updates, and able to get to services like NetFlix and Amazon on demand.  This TV does that and more.  The double sided remote works great for setup and searching.  I got mine for $750, so as long as it keeps working I'm having a hard time finding issue.  Buy the way, I mounted it on the wall, way too easy, the TV is lite and when needed it "hides" really nicely, compared to the old Plasma that was in the same spot.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, poor motion blur
Reviews.Author: B. Jones
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV a few months ago from a large retailer on sale. Of all the TV's that offered 120Hz refresh rate, this was about $150 cheaper. I thought that it was an amazing deal considering the full price was equivalent to competitor brands of similar specifications. The picture quality is outstanding, and I couldn't be pleased more for the price I paid. However, after my father bought a new TV with the same specs except for the size (42" for me, 40" for him) I realized that my motion blur seemed a bit lacking. After extensive research, I have found that the "120Hz refresh rate" is an artificial and boosted "spec". Vizio claims it's 120Hz SPS or Scenes Per Second. Basically what it does is, the TV itself attempts to create additional images of each frame and insert them between the native frames. While this is clearly better than a native 60Hz tv, it is nowhere, and I mean NOWHERE, near the clarity of a native 120Hz TV. It is a good TV and I am genuinely impressed by the quality to value, but I warn future buyers to ensure that they get everything they expect out of the price they're paying for their TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, poor packaging by reseller
Reviews.Author: rennan
Reviews.Content: I found this TV on Amazon, and purchased it from a reseller, Secondipity.  When it arrived, one corner of the box was torn.  I unpacked the TV, and it wasn't inside a protective bag, and the foam bolsters that hold the TV in place were poorly placed to prevent the TV from shifting inside the box.  There was mud and grass on the corner of the TV that was by the hole in the box.  I checked the contents, and the only thing missing was any form of documentation.  So far, it isn't looking good.I went ahead and hooked up the TV to see if it worked, and to my surprise, everything worked and there were no dead pixels, in-spite of the way the TV had been repackaged and abused.  I cleaned it up and set it up.  I didn't contact Secondipity to complain about the packaging since I was keeping the TV and it wouldn't do any good.  With that said, I will never purchase anything else from Secondipity.  I gave them one shot, and they blew it.  You may have a different experience, but you've been warned.The TV has a great picture, lots of features and the setup was easy.  The biggest problem with it is the remote control.  It is too small for the number of buttons and for this reason, the buttons are too small.  The up-down-left-right buttons are hard to use due to the diminutive size.  It might be OK for someone with small hands, but for medium to large hands, it's awkward.  I have a "learning remote" that I have tried to program, but it won't take some of the signals from the Vizio remote, so, I'll just have to put up with this tiny awkward remote.The sound is acceptable.  I don't like the sound on most flat-panel TV's because most have the same sound quality as two tin cans and a string.  As with any TV, you'll only get great sound with a sound system, but at least this one is one of the better sounding TV's.I've been having fun with the internet apps, but haven't made any commitment to any paid service yet.  The built-in WiFi works good.  I only wish that it was dual-band so I could use it on the 5GHz band.  I don't know if any TV manufacturer makes a dual-band TV, but I'm sure they will be out in the near future.If it weren't for the remote control, I would have given this TV 5 stars.  Since I have large hands, it only gets 4 stars.UPDATE:After posting this review, I received an email from Secondipity.  They offered me a $50 refund on the TV which I accepted.  Their email said:"We sincerely apologize the item was delivered to you in the manner that it was. We will file an investigation with the warehouse to see why the item was shipped in that manner. All items are to be tested and inspected before shipment."This does make me feel better about doing business with them in the future, knowing that they actually do care about how things are shipped and customer satisfaction.On another note, I have purchased a Vizio XRU300 8-Device Universal Learning Remote.  It has all of the buttons of the original remote with the exception of the App buttons (Amazon, Netflix, Vudu), but since it is a learning remote, these buttons can be programmed on some other unused buttons.  It also has larger buttons, and since it can control multiple devices... this is the remote to use for a Vizio TV.  It works my sound system, DVR, DVD, and has left over buttons for other devices.  Since it is a "Learning" remote, buttons can be reprogrammed to suit your needs.  If it only had macros, it would be perfect.  Also, it doesn't have the Qwerty keyboard on the back, but, I don't really use that very often.  It can be found for around $20.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Super Happy "Happy"
Reviews.Content: Great TV, great picture, great apps, well made. No problems. Got it for $430 with some promotions. Heh... took 10 minutes to set up with Aurum HDMI cables and DirecTV Home Media Center DVR.Olympics look great.

Reviews.Title: Great Value/Great Picture but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Zestious
Reviews.Content: Why this product got Four Stars:1. Ultra-slim profile2. Good built-in sound3. Great picture4. Visio Apps are great(Has Youtube, Netflix, etc.)5. Size is great at 42"6. Keyboard on remote is great to have when trying to search Youtube and NetflixWhy it does not get 5 stars:1. No built-in web bowser Visio App2. No S-Video connection for devices without HDMI3. Feedback for keyboard on remote is lacking(you have to press keys hard)4. Skype App requires you to purchase a Visio Webcam ($80) extra; Skype won't work without it.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional Picture and Rich Feature Set
Reviews.Author: Hasan al-Basri "hasan"
Reviews.Content: This TV is a superb performer in terms of picture quality, feature set and user friendliness, all for a very good price. Comparing it to a 3 year old Sanyo LCD, (720p/60 Hz), the difference is quite dramatic. The picture has excellent contrast ratio (roughly the ratio of the brightest white to the deepest black that the light panel can produce). This measure (if not fudged by the manufacturer, which many, many televisions these days are), "should" indicate how "brilliant", "alive" or "dynamic" the picture will appear. Do not, under any circumstances trust published specs by the manufacturer. Many are grossly exaggerated, and few, if any, state how these measurements are made. Some others are just plain advertized incorrectly. I saw two TVs at the local Wal-Mart that showed two Vizio TVs with a contrast ratio of 2,000,000:1, when it plainly should have been 200,000. Off by a factor of 10, but who's counting?Suffice it to say, this TV, with a claimed contrast ratio of 200,000:1, has a brilliant and dynamic picture. It is the sort of TV that if seen on a wall of TVs, will jump out at you for three factors: image clarity, color saturation and "dynamic liveliness" of the picture. Don't get me wrong, this is not a $2500 Samsung. Its motion clarity is not nearly as good. The overall picture quality is not nearly as good. The feature set, however,  is every bit as good as the elite TVs.There are many outstanding and well implemented features on this TV. They include, but are not limited to:1. 4 HDMI inputs2. Analog Audio Out (3.5 mm headphone type jack) for use with wireless headphones and such.3. Optical Digital Out for use with soundbars and older non-hdmi switching home theater amps.4. The sensitivity of the TV tuner is very good, and the signal level and other info is available from a "system" menu.5. WIFI and Internet Apps6. Nice, but not exceptional remote (no back light), but has full QWERTY keyboard on back)The WIFI setup was quick and easy. It found the SSID of my router immediately and connected with no problems. Performance is impressive based on two measures: throughput and signal strength.  The TV is about 30 feet away and one floor up from the router. I consistently see > 4.5 Mb/s from my 6.0 Mb/s connection, even during the evening. There is a nice speed utility built into the TV that shows the throughput of the connection. I had no problem streaming HDX (1080p from Vudu) or Netflix HD. There were no interruptions or pixellation for either service.  There is a little bar graph and icon that appear briefly at the top right corner of the display which show signal strength (mine shows full scale). It looks like this TV's WIFI would see the router easily from the other end of the house (although this is an A-Frame open construction scenario).One Caveat: The TV is listed as 120 Hz refresh rate. It isn't really. As one other reviewer noted, Vizio plays a game with the refresh rate that does reduce motion blur, but it is not truly 120 Hz refresh. Consumer Reports took note of this and lists this TV's refresh rate as 60 Hz. There is no "smooth motion" adjustment in the menu...for a very good reason, this TV does not have Vizio's traditional "smooth motion" technology. That's one reason why it is less expensive. It is also why the higher end Samsung that I own, and other higher end Vizios (with true smooth motion) are clearly superior to the M420SL when it comes to ameliorating motion artifacts that LCDs are so well known for. It should also be noted that some people do not like smooth motion, period, and turn it off, so I would not make a purchasing decision on this TV based on the 120 Hz shortcoming.Summary:A TV rich in features that are actually useful, with a strikingly beautiful picture at a moderate price. While lacking a web browser, its internet features and performance should more than satisfy those interested in Vudu, NetFlix and assorted internet widgets/apps.

Reviews.Title: TV stopped working after 11 months. Amazon seller wasn't authorized reseller. No Warranty. Complete loss.
Reviews.Author: Alexander Castro
Reviews.Content: Well, this was a bad experience. I purchased this from an Amazon marketplace seller. The TV stopped working after 11 months. I contacted Vizio and they told me it was liquidated via Wal-Mart and sold through an un-authorized reseller on Amazon (One Stop Shop) and that the warranty was null and void. So basically I am out $625+ for a TV that didn't last a year. The TV was a bit flaky to start with but it worked and the picture was fine. But a TV should last more than a year. Amazons shouldn't allow resellers to sell stuff on their site with no warranty unless it is very explicitly called out. Next time I buy a Samsung from Costco (where they always take it back). I'm a big time Amazon customer and really unhappy about this. Google online and you'll see that Vizio TVs break down in 12-24 months all the time. Wish I searched the Internet first. Don't waste your money on a Vizio.

Reviews.Title: High definition in every way!
Reviews.Author: The Spud
Reviews.Content: We got this kind of Vizio Razor last November, and it has been outstanding. It has a crystal clear picture, equally clear sound, and it's practically paper-thin.  Before we got this TV, I had read many reviews for other brands of high-definition TVs that mentioned bad sound quality. Some of the most expensive brands had reviews that complained of muffled or metallic sound quality, but the sound quality of this Vizio Razor is perfect. The sound on several of our home movies used to be pretty hard to hear, but when we watched some of them on our new Vizio the sound quality was loud and clear. This was before we even bought a Blu-Ray player; this TV improved the sound on home movies played on standard-definition DVD players!After we got our Blu-ray player, we really got a taste of what this TV can do. I didn't know a TV could have a picture that clear and defined. You can really see the picture quality when you pause a Blu-Ray movie, the paused image looks like a photo taken with a new digital camera.LED technology makes a huge difference in picture quality, but it also has several other advantages. Until fairly recently, the picture displays on LCD TVs were backlit with florescent bulbs; but LCD TVs that are backlit with LED lights (like this one) are much better. LED lights last longer than florescent bulbs, and LED lights don't contain any mercury.It also has wireless internet access. It is amazing how you can access YouTube and play movie trailers right on the TV.This Vizio Razor is also compatible with the new TV Guardian (a device that edits out bad language from shows and movies).

Reviews.Title: Visio M420SL
Reviews.Author: Wayne E. Wagner
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for 30  days  so far it's good. Happy with product.Would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: Best TV ever owned
Reviews.Author: frlouis
Reviews.Content: This TV provides ease of set-up and displays the most incredible HD I've ever seen.  I can now watch my tennis matches and see line calls clearly and read the score at the same time.  Truly worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Mob Hunter "duveen"
Reviews.Content: This TV was for our family room and is not in our main "theater space."  We mostly use it for watching TV and the occasional sporting event.  The picture is excellent and the color was just about right for our room out of the box.  Sound is good for set speakers, plenty for this room.  The QWERTY keyboard is nice on the remote and makes life easier.  The TV picks up our WiFi easily and we've had no difficulty streaming to the set.I do have a couple of dislikes.  First, the HDMI ports, placed along the outside edge of the back of the set, force the cable to stick out beyond the side of the set.  These ports should have been placed farther toward the center of the back of the set or faced downwards so that the cords could go straight down to minimize this.Second, the set takes forever to "boot up."  It is a long enough process that I use the remove to turn the set on and then go to the bathroom, make coffee, or something that takes at least a minute so that this time isn't wasted.  It isn't make-or-break for me, but I've never had another TV take this long to simply turn itself on.Third, and this may not be a problem with the set, is the fact that my Amazon Prime account info cannot be stored on the set.  This means that every time I want to watch something through my Prime account, I have to get a new access number through my Amazon account via a computer and then plug that number into my TV via the remote.  This is hardly plug-and-play.  I want to be able to store a password in the computer and be able to simply click-and-watch each and every time.  If this is the TV, I fault the TV.  If it is Amazon, I fault Amazon.  Either way, it was worth mentioning as a quality of life issue.Finally, as with most electronics today, the printed documentation consists of next to nothing.  Good for the environment.  Bad for the consumer experience.  Not a fan.I would buy this set again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: 42" LED TV
Reviews.Author: huntinbob06
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I am proud to support American companies. I'm really glad I did in this case. The picture rivals that of my plasma. High def channels are brilliant and blu ray look excellent. The sound for a flat panel is great. The apps were a cynch to set up.  $600 on Amazon with free shipping and no tax was a steal. Visio is a top notch manufacturer. I definitely recommend this set.

Reviews.Title: Superb quality
Reviews.Author: NYer
Reviews.Content: Its a great deal for the money you pay. Agreed the brand is not one of the elitest, but for the price you pay you get much more than the Samsungs and Sonys of the world. Very slick, can be wall mounted or placed on a coffee table. Not heavy at all. Assembly is very simple. I love the remote control.So far its been a great investment !

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Sandra Gelinas
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with this TV. It has a great picture, the sound is good enough for us for watching movies, and best of all - we were able to get it to work without alot of trouble.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be better. Seriously.
Reviews.Author: JS
Reviews.Content: Fantastic TV for the price. Absolute value. Everyone probably already knows the picture is clear and brilliant, but you might not know that the sound absolutely rocks as well.4x HDMI ports are also great. 1 for cable, 1 for the Xbox, 1 for the video file player, and 1 for the Blu-Ray player. It's amazing how many of these you need these days.I seriously considered two other similar LED 42 inch televisions that were a little cheaper - the Vizio E420I and the Sony Bravia KDL-42EX440. While both of those other TVs are very good, and also had great pictures, the Vizio M420SL has more features than the Sony, and has better sound than both, with a real sound bar. It also has more HDMI ports than the others. The extra money was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV!
Reviews.Author: Marissa
Reviews.Content: I got an amazing deal on this TV and I couldn't be happier. We only have basic channels at home, and primarily use the TV for Netflix and Amazon Instant with our Roku. When our old TV took a dump, I took a chance on this Vizio M420SL, even though most of my research pulled up negative reviews. I was skeptical when the majority of positive reviews I found were directly from the Vizio site. Nonetheless, I went for it.First off, set up was a breeze for the tech-savvy consumer. I easily connected it to our wireless network and had my Netflix and Amazon accounts set up within 10 minutes. The quality of viewing is awesome. The digital HD local channels we get look amazing, too. I can see literally all of Maggie Smith's glorious wrinkles during Downton Abbey and Fred Armisen's face on Portlandia looks as smooth as a baby's bottom.The remote is pretty fantastic too. One side has your typical controls, with the added dedicated Netflix and Amazon Instant buttons, but the other side of the remote is a full keyboard! That in itself was worth it. I hate using the arrow+OK buttons to search for something with a normal remote. And if you accidentally key in the wrong letter, forget it.Overall, super happy with this purchase. I'd been holding out for a Smart TV for a while, and this was totally worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: Great set!
Reviews.Author: S. HOLT
Reviews.Content: It's picture is outstanding and set up was a snap. I love the remote and how one can type on the double sided keys! A perfect tv for our room..

Reviews.Title: Great except for the sound
Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: The sound is just a bit timid and wonky on this. We have to turn it up quite high when sitting on the sofa watching a show, but if you go into our bedroom (shares the wall with the back of the tv) it's quite loud.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Ed Shackelford
Reviews.Content: The VIZIO M420SL 42- inch 120Hz LED-lit TV has great quality and an excellent picture. It is wall mounted and made a nice addition in my man cave!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: mikemikemike
Reviews.Content: The wi-fi set up was simple, especially with the full QWERTY keyboard on the back of the remote. The applications are designed well enough that I'm not going to pay for cable anymore and I'm just going to use Netflix and hulu.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for price
Reviews.Author: Corley Owen
Reviews.Content: Great TV.  Fantastic sound.  Recently bought this TV & love it except for an occasional thin line of pixel disruption. Chkg satellite reception.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Gov
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  For the price I'm not sure you could ask for much more.  I didn't need 3D, so this gives me everything I needed.  The picture is clear, and even SD TV shows look good.  Not HD quality, mind you, but good.  The blu-rays look spectacluar.The one and only problem I've had with this TV is concerning the wi-fi.  During setup it asks you to set up your wi-fi connection which makes sense because it comes with apps.  However, I found out quickly that the TV tends to overload my old G router, so I wanted to just disconnect the wireless because I don't use the apps much.  But you can't do it.  The only way I've found to disconnect the wireless is to plug in an ethernet cable (or change my SSID).  I'm hoping to have a new router in a month or two anyway so at this point I will leave it hard-wired.Other than that it's great!

Reviews.Title: Amazing product - Great picture and sound
Reviews.Author: Shany Jacob
Reviews.Content: I thought I would use this product for a month and then write a review.I used to own a 26" LCD from Vizio. I did not have any problems for 3 years and still works. Since I moved to a bigger appartment, I want to buy a bigger one. After going through many mixed reviews about this product, I thought I would give it a try.The Product came sooner than I expected. It was packed nicely.It took me just about 15 minutes to set it up by myself.The sound and the picture quality are amazing.I love the multi-USB and multi-HDMI ports.Setting up the wi-fi was a breeze. You just have to follow the instructions. So is setting up the Amazon video and Netflix.I had an issue with the remote after a few weeks. It wouldn't work. I called up customer care and they said to remove the batteries, press all the buttons on the remote twice and put the batteries back in. It worked!Overall, an amazing TV. I am a very satisfied customer.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv by Vizio
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Stntn "pstntn"
Reviews.Content: Received this TV as an early Christmas present two days ago.  So far I am completely thrilled with it.  HD channels are awesome.  You can actually count the freckles on faces.  My son who is techno savvy set it up in less than 1/2 hour.  I highly recommend Vizio tvs as this is our 3rd one and a plus they are made in America!

Reviews.Title: Good TV poor responsiveness from remote
Reviews.Author: John Flanagan
Reviews.Content: The TV pictured on the website is not the same one that was shipped.  The last two letters in the model number are SL.  The picture is for the KM (think newer model).  Thanks to Amazon's customer service, item returned.

Reviews.Title: Love the picture and sound quality!
Reviews.Author: jamjelly "Love to shop"
Reviews.Content: We finally bought a "modern" tv based on other reviewers reports. I am so pleased with this set, how easy it was to set it up, and how slim it is. This may not be the largest tv, but it is perfect for our budget.

Reviews.Title: Frustrated with wifi
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else has said already, setup was incredibly easy and intuitive. For whatever reason, the tv is having a really difficult time staying connected to wifi. My wireless router is no more than 20' from the tv, and there are no obstructions in between. Netflix needs to buffer frequently, and I keep getting booted from my network. None of my other devices have this problem, so why does my brand new TV need such care? Connected via ethernet cable works fast and flawlessly, but what's the point of a wifi tv then?

Reviews.Title: Absolutely amazing!
Reviews.Author: M. Parikh "Cloud 9"
Reviews.Content: I normally don't write many reviews, but after having this TV for a week, I couldn't help but write one. Vizio did it right with this one. It took me about 20 minutes to get the TV set up and updated with the latest firmware. As soon as you set up the wi-fi, the TV does everything else. The apps have been pretty good and I've been able to get my Amazon Instant Video along with Netflix so that's definitely a plus. The apps could use a revamp to get a more modern look, but they do exactly what they're supposed to do so I can't really complain about that.The picture clarity is stunning on HD and I had some computer speakers so I was able to hook them up into the PCM jack. If there's one thing I could pick at, it would have to be the speakers on the tv. It sounds really flat and if you're a sound enthusiast like me, you'll want to get a sound bar at the least.

Reviews.Title: wi-fi doesn't work well
Reviews.Author: doc lee
Reviews.Content: wi-fi doesn't work well.picture is great though.But not a SMART tv after all.There is no web-browsing option.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: madmit
Reviews.Content: I bough this TV for my den, and after doing research on all the 42 inch TVS, I decided on the Vizio, as it seemed to be the best value, without compromising anything. I can connect to the internet, stream from Amazon Prime(Netflix too), go on Facebook, Twitter, and several others. You cannot do google searches - there are limited applications, but it's plenty. Also, my son was able to get this TV up and running completely in about 15 minutes(he's 15). My ONLY negative, which doesn't bother me, is that it takes a bit of time for it to come on once you turn it on. Not a big deal but it's a bit longer than I'm used to from other TVs. All in all, I'd say this TV is an EXCELLENT TV and a GREAT value!! I even saw them give away the same exact one on ELLEN the other day!!

Reviews.Title: reservations
Reviews.Author: John R. Gadd "jrg10"
Reviews.Content: This "smart" TV may not be suitible for antenna reception. Having problem setting and maintaining screen aspect ratio ie size of picture viewed. Also, the guide feature only dispays the current program being aired and not future programming. The 37 inch vizio I replaced, which was not a smart TV did not have these issues. I called custommer help line and was told these features have been dropped on smart tv's. I quess over the air programming is being discouraged.

Reviews.Title: The tv is great but...
Reviews.Author: josh
Reviews.Content: This tv is great provided you receive it in one piece. I bought this tv making sure it was from amazon thinking that it would be packaged well and shipped in a timely manor, not the case. The tv was in the same box you might get from  Walmart or something which is fine besides in this case its shipped hundreds of miles my many people that don't care much about their job. My tv was bent and dented amazon said they would buy it back but not replace it as there was no more in stock, just turned into a hassle. I have 232 purchases from amazon 167 are songs and only 2 are electronics I will never again buy electronics or anything more than $50 from amazon.

Reviews.Title: No picture a little after a year
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey Jones
Reviews.Content: Backlight went out about 13 mos after purchase a total waste of money. Will not but from vizio again. Would not recommend this television at all.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: joanne lee "jolee"
Reviews.Content: I looked a long time for this model and it wasn't easy to find but finally found it on amazon of course.should have looked here first.bwas specifically looking for a tv with good sound as i'm hard of hearing.I am so pleased with the purchase because of the sound but also because of the clear picture.the only negative is it takes longer to come on than my other TV's but that is really not a big issue.

Reviews.Title: The IR/Remote stopped working
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: I bought it new about a year ago and just today the remote stopped working. Then I checked to see if the buttons on the side of the tv worked, but those too didnt work. I love the picture on this tv, but the reason I gave it two stars is because i've only had this tv for about a year and now I have this problem to fix.

Reviews.Title: Reason for the rating I gave
Reviews.Author: Sarah Pinkney-Murkey
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice tv.  It has everything I wanted in a tv at an excellent cost.  I compared it with other name brand televisions in the same catagory and this tv was about $200.00 cheaper.  The picture is clear the Wi - Fi  works perfectly and the sound is good.  I am ver please.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO
Reviews.Author: Ken Fougère "Ken Fougère"
Reviews.Content: VIZIO M420SL 42-Inch 120Hz LED-lit TVhttp://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B007USA1F4/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_5I HAVE A SONY 46" AND A LG 32" 1080i HDTVs AND NIETHER ONE COMES CLOSE TO THE PICTURE QUALITY OF MYVIZIO M420SL 42-Inch 120Hz LED-lit  HDTV !

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, easy to use
Reviews.Author: Kathy North
Reviews.Content: I am  not a TV expert... we were upgrading from a tiny screen to this, and getting rid of cable to go to wi-fi.  This TV has a great picture, is easy to use (we get Netflix) and shipped early.  I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: No complaints so far
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: Giving this product 5 stars so far because any complaints are minor. Note: owned the tv for 1.5 months and strictly using it for the Internet apps.Likes:Quick and easy setup. Internet out of the box.Powering on was faster than expected. Roughly 15 seconds.Great picture and sound.Remote is compact with good layout. No unnecessary buttons and qwerty keyboard comes in handy.Dislikes:Remote not backlit making qwerty keyboard not as effective in the dark.HD sometimes cuts out. Might have more to do with distance from router.Overall very pleased and well worth the price. Will update if there are any major issues.

Reviews.Title: Nice large screen with narrow border
Reviews.Author: Christine B. France
Reviews.Content: Very good high def tv. Would like to have a more common audio output port from tv to home theater (rca/coaxial). Very thin unit. Overall, great system.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Daniel R. Greenberg
Reviews.Content: The TV was shipped very fast.  The box was damaged, but it doesn't seem that it effected the TV.The remote is not a very easy one to use.  The buttons are small, a bit 'sticky', and I wish they lit up.

Reviews.Title: Very nice unit
Reviews.Author: D  Clark
Reviews.Content: If this is the size tv that your looking for I would suggest you take a look at this unit.  I'm very satisfied with it

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Picture Quality, Great Price
Reviews.Author: Pamela Roberts
Reviews.Content: Our old Vizio 32inch was impressive so we decided to try the larger Vizio Smart TV M420SL.  Amazing picture quality that rivals all other brands including Samsung and Sony. We bought through Amazon because the price was flat out the best. This Vizio is easy to set up and easy to navigate. We received the Smart TV promptly and in perfect condition.  Yes, I would recommend this product to anyone. Best Value for your money.

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV good quality
Reviews.Author: mountaingal
Reviews.Content: The  TV has a wonderful picture and we are very happy. Reviews on the TV were rated very high and we are happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture and all the great features of a smart TV
Reviews.Author: Bumpama
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set upand meets all my expectations for this set. A great valve for this TV. I should have ordered it sooner so I could have enjoyed it for all the baseball and football gamesfor the past six months.

Reviews.Title: Blown away!
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Given my limited budget I expected a few disappointments.  I am so glad I I went with this tv!  Great color, great apps, great closed caption support with transparent text background and striking clarity, good clear sound with forward facing speakers, lots of inputs.  Got mine from Sams for about $500, couldn't be happier for the money I spent!

Reviews.Title: Can't fail with this choice.
Reviews.Author: S. Mayle "Noob Tech"
Reviews.Content: I like all of the features that comes with it and like the Vizio brand, that and Samsung TVs. What got me to buy it was the price, it was a deal for a 120Hz HD TV, but that was during Black Friday.

Reviews.Title: Last Month
Reviews.Author: Karen Bowers
Reviews.Content: Bought this television last month, we couldn't be happier. Easy to set up, beautiful picture and sound. Great value, I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Great picture!
Reviews.Author: Matt Dowell
Reviews.Content: Got this TV for our master bedroom, and couldn't be happier!  Great picture, and it has Netflix built in, so no other device needed to stream it.  The remote is a little funky, but it works OK.  I use the remote for my FiOS to control it for most normal, everyday kind of things anyways...I only use this remote for when I want to watch Netflix...

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: C. L. Gordon
Reviews.Content: Easy to setup and with the Zvox soundbar I bought it is great.  We had a 37" in the bedroom but replaced it with this one and it makes a world of difference.  Go get one.

Reviews.Title: led tv
Reviews.Author: gint
Reviews.Content: Vizio led tv is as good as advertised; great picture, many options.  Prime delivery at n/c nice.  Quality seems as good as Sony lcd sets we own.GG

Reviews.Title: No Mounting Holes
Reviews.Author: Jerry Griffin
Reviews.Content: You have to be kidding me.  I just returned a TV and ordered this one - and I was very excited.  I unpacked it carried it where I was going to mount itAND SURPRISE - There are no standard MOUNTING holes on the Television.  I own two other VIZIO's and all have mounting holes.Now - I'm going to have to pack this up and send it back.  I just can't believe it.  NO MOUNTING HOLES

Reviews.Title: Love it! Great picture and sound.
Reviews.Author: Nashville Mommy
Reviews.Content: I am far from an expert when it comes to electronics, but I read a LOT of reviews before buying this television. It was delivered quickly, safely, and well packaged. I have used a couple of tips from prior reviews that I found helpful. (like how to turn off the glowing Vizio logo)Regular (non HD) channels don't look much different than my last television, but WOW does the HD look great!!!! I have not experienced any issues with the sound, but will refer to the reviewer who tells how to fix that too if I do. Thanks everyone for sharing the tips and don't hesitate to buy this wonderful television set.

Reviews.Title: Power board issues with all vizio tv's
Reviews.Author: Vernon Gudger Jr
Reviews.Content: Problem started 3 months after I purchased this tv. Quality picture but the hardware malfunctions all the time. Vizio brand is to blame

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: Debra A Osteen
Reviews.Content: We love the TV because it has a great picture and decent sound.  We really like being able to watch YouTube videos and stream Netflix movies.  It even has Skype!  Cool TV!

Reviews.Title: The Little Brand that Could!
Reviews.Author: mom2er
Reviews.Content: Super-duper pleased with my purchase!  I did a lot of research in stores and online before this purchase.  I was in the market for a Samsung or LG smart TV, but discovered this VIZIO in Consumer Reports. This VIZIO looks absolutely beautiful, no glare TV. Came really fast and delivered in perfect condition. Hook up was quite straightforward other than a little glitch with cable box. I'm sure my fault:-/ WiFi was a zip, entered my router info and up it went. Fits perfectly in my pine Armoire with a couple of inches on either side for easy access. I measured;-) Still trying to get all the setting to my liking, but that's the fun part!  Would highly recommend this little brand that could...VIZIO!

Reviews.Title: No browser access.
Reviews.Author: Sheila R. Webster
Reviews.Content: You are limited only to Vizio approved Apps. NO PBS, No Hulu, Just select apps. What a waste of money

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for the money!!
Reviews.Author: Buskirkzz
Reviews.Content: I bought this back in July of 2012. I mainly use this as a gaming display. Anything I play on it looks great. I currently have it in a dark room, where it can be overwhelmingly bright, but I don't intend on it being there forever. The display is very responsive when gaming. The internet apps work pretty smooth as well. The picture quality is great for Blu-Rays as well!My only two gripes about this TV are as follows:1. The speakers are sub-par. They make strange noises at higher frequencies. I use headphones mainly, and when I don't I use external speakers. Doesn't bother me personally, others this may be an issue.2. Some of the buttons of the keyboard side of the remote I have to press pretty firmly to get a response. Mostly the "R" button, but others too.Overall this TV is great and stacks up very well with much more expensive, non-internet, TVs.

Reviews.Title: Problems
Reviews.Author: Chris C. Grier "Dog Lover"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv from walmart I thought it had the great picture for the price..I wish they had it where the sun don't shine..It went nuts and would not do nothing a couple months old, they replaced the main board,,,, about 4 months, it is doing the same thing again.I so wish I had not bought a vizio, I would rather have another brand...They have told me to provide the receipt and they was going to replace the tv instead of repairing it this time.. we will see.

Reviews.Title: sent it back
Reviews.Author: Christopher A. Jones
Reviews.Content: junk  you know something is wrong when batteries  are not included. Cheap, and remote lacks on  all accounts. Do not buy.

Reviews.Title: I need an answer ASAP PLEASE
Reviews.Author: osubuck32
Reviews.Content: I would like make my TV purchase today and have pretty much narrowed it down to these two Vizio's. Can anyone tell me the difference between this model and the Vizio E420i-A1 and which one is better since they are only $25 a part in total cost?http://www.amazon.com/VIZIO-E420i-A1-42-inch-1080p-120Hz/dp/B009IBXECS/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid;=1353912756&sr;=8-1&keywords;=VIZIO+E420i-A1the E420i is $25 cheaper and appears to have a thinner edge running all the way around which looks better IMO and also appears to have come out later (aka newer TV set) than the M420SL.Any quick answers are greatly appreciated. Thanks all

Reviews.Title: Great. BUT tv has a pea sized blacked out area on monitor!  Can't figure out how to contact seller!?
Reviews.Author: K. Goodman
Reviews.Content: Frustrating. I thought the mark was dust. When I finally went to wipe it off, I found it to be imprinted in the monitor.  I don't want to just return it as I will be without a tv. Is it possible to have a new one sent out and then I will return this one. Seems like a great tv, but very frustrating to buy a NEW tv and have it be damaged. Customer service help?

Reviews.Title: Wi
Reviews.Author: Riki
Reviews.Content: Bad: Wifi ready? Means what, Vizio apps? NO web brower means no surfing, and NO Adobe flash. But does have 4 HDMI, to connect a  Logitech Revue and you are surfing with Google.Good: Vizio M420sl does have a user friendly double sided remote with keyboard. Picture is very clearWill keep, later move to bedroom when these wifi ready are truly ready.

Reviews.Title: Pleased, so far...(update)
Reviews.Author: Chairman Maoricio
Reviews.Content: So far so good.  It looks good (and you can turn off the vizio emblem light), it performs great, netflix looks amazing via wireless and worked well once I got the kinks out of it, sound is good enough that I took back the annoying sound bar that I bought to go with it, and I'm hoping it will last(!).I haven't noticed any defects yet, but I'm not too picky.  It's a big improvement from the 32" we had before.Update:  Based on user comments I've updated to 4 stars, probably pretty late to make a difference.  If a brand goes bad on you after less than 2 yrs; minus 1 for that brand.  Bad on them for not using a higher grade of internal electronics, and who's to say it wouldn't happen again. That said, this one is behaving itself and the picture is very good.  However...the apps, especially Hulu plus, are often buggy or just plain cheap (with the exception of the Netflix app that works great). Improve those and I'll consider rating this tv as 5 stars.
